column5: For Perch, 3Lb test with micro jig and a Perch eye. Be using that in the morning on Simcoe.

Live Target Golden Shiner lipless crank for walleye/pike.  I use lots of other presentations/baits/lures, but that one is my favorite.  Close second is plastics(various worms) with the Northland shakeyhead jig
Vinkula spoon with chartreus stripe and minnow head
Carling or weisers
Simcoe jumbo Perch 2 words- SLAB GRABBER

I'm fairly new to the Ice fishing scene but I've had the best luck with a simple Spit shot, hook & minnow. Some of the guys I go with use Jig heads tipped with minnows and swear by Chartreuse or orange but in truth....they don't get any more fish then I do so I'm not really sold that the Jig head (or color) adds anything to the waters I fish. I've used a Swedish Pimple, and jigging raps as well in a variety of colors and sizes but non produced better for me then a live minnow on a hook.
If I could only have one lure for icefishing it would be a half and half williams #50. No question.  I've caught every fish that swims on that lure.  S.
Changed my mind. If I had one lure it would be whatever Chad lends me. Its the only way I can catch walleye.
Add a few maggots to that bottom treble and that's my best perch bait by far (Even in open water)
Kastmaster jigging spoon.. i really never use anything else
hahaha. You should of added 3" chartreuse twister and a 1/4oz jig head right from the start.
Definitely...I never set foot on the ice for Brookies without bringing worms!   You don't always need them but more often than not, they save the day!
Perch- 1/8 oz chartreuse jig head with a shiner pike- chartreuse 1/8oz bucktail tipped with shiner  Haven't caught anything else yet lol
Yes worms are excellent for trout... also salties when they are finicky and don't want worms
Meegs with a minnow or small tube.
When I ice fish, its usually a 1/4 inch chartruse jig with a minnow on it.. simple and old school..  Whats your favourite ice fishing lure??
Im a newbie so im going with just a emerald shinner, hook, and a couple of split shots.  Anybody else have a different way to catch perch just write them down.  Thanks guys
If I only had 1 lure it would be a spreadder with a single hook 3 ft up
Micro tube with a minnow head. The panfish love it and even some of the sport fish will hit it if you convince them.

my favourites:  the smallest jiggin rap tipped with something like a minnow head, pinhead, mealworm or gulp  krocodile or gibbs gator spoon with 4" dropper to a gamakatsu hook with a minnow(walleye) or shrimp(trout)
walleye hawger...tipped with a shiner..has great to me on nipissing walleye and perch
im still fairly new, but have been successful with the Airplane jig.  minnow and split shot always work well  this year ill be using the williams spoons and lindy darters more often
williams ice spoon, white jig head and shiner ... lakers , whitefish  shiner on a chartreuse jig ... walleye
Williams silver/gold center hooks removed with a pearl/stinger hook a foot back) lakers and whitefish . . .
-1/4oz jig head with grub or minnow -any darter minnows -flutter spoons, dartees -wirek spoons (silver)
Buckshot for me or Lindy's flying spoon.
For my jigging rod I use Northland Macho Minnow 1/4oz tip with Gulp fish fry or 1" minnow.  For my dead sticks, hook tip with salty and a cone shape sinker above the leader.
A small buckshot tipped with grub or minnow
Buckshot rattle  with a minnow (just the head if I want to downsize.) But I add 2 small willow blades on the split ring where I attach my line.
for walters,gotta be a small jig/minnow,for lakers williams half/half with a dropper line and stinger hook !!!!
A pair of ice tongs so I don't get my fingers wet and dirty up my scotch.   Art
Naked jigging rap. Will catch anything, anywhere I fish.
One of my favs as well.

Chartreuse anything!  My go to colour is always chartreuse.  1/8 oz jigs or buckshots for perch.  Lakers, whities I used Williams in a variety of silver, gold, hammered, half n half.  Different colours for different light conditions.  If I'm jigging walleye on Nip its a 1/4 oz chartreuse jig tipped with a full minnow.  Lake Erie the perch like my offering of chartreuse 1/4 oz jigs tipped with a minnow.

For pannies- jiggin rap  For walleye- 1/4 oz knuckleball chartreuse and orange. Unless I'm on Quinte then nothin beats a CC spoon IMO.  For lakers- mepps cyclops or airplane.  For pike- No lure required, just a big dead minnow and a good baitholder hook. Or snag someone else's line LOL  For brook trout- no clue, can't ever get em
trout - worm on hook everything else - minnow on hook  catch fish hard...
Jiggin Rap and Gold Buckshot.
Worm and hook for hardwater trout? Interesting.
chubby darter half-and-half williams spoon (whitefish one with the hooks on the side)

Smallest jigging rap in chrome  blue... For perch  3/4 oz northland buckshot spoon in green with stinger hook and a few small minnows... For walleye  And northland airplane bucktail jigs in green with a 5-6 inch minnow...for pike
